data.question: What is the primary reaction described in the article?
data.answer: The asymmetric intramolecular hydroamination of allenes catalyzed by phosphinegold(I)âˆ’bis-p-nitrobenzoate complexes.

data.question: Which complexes were found to catalyze the transformation with good enantioselectivity?
data.answer: A variety of BINAP and biaryl-based gold complexes were found to catalyze the transformation with good enantioselectivity.

data.question: What was the effect of employing benzoate counterions in the reaction?
data.answer: Employing benzoate counterions resulted in a dramatic amplification of enantiomeric excess.

data.question: True or False: The use of silver p-nitrobenzoate increased the yield of the reaction with no loss of enantioselectivity.
What was the purpose of using a mixture generated from precatalyst 3 and 2 equiv of AgOPNB?
data.answer: The purpose was to investigate the nature of the in situ generated catalyst for the reaction.

data.question: True or False: The reaction could be extended to substrates containing substitution in the tether without any modifications.
What was the role of the counterion in the enantioselectivity of the gold-catalyzed intramolecular hydroamination of allenes?
data.answer: The counterion played a crucial role in the enantioselectivity of the reaction, with larger coordinated counterions increasing the transmission of chiral information.

data.question: True or False: The substrate scope was limited to cyclic alkanes only.
What was the outcome of treating tosylamine 1 with precatalyst 3 and 2 equiv of silver benzoate?
data.answer: The treatment provided 2 with excellent (98%) ee, but was low yielding even after extended reaction times.

data.question: True or False: All reactions conducted in the study were performed under an inert atmosphere.
